text: this was a direct intervention by mr.
Netanyahu in American politics the Prime
Minister of Israel his Excellency
Benjamin at Yahoo the introduction was
from the Republican Speaker John Boehner
who invited Israel's prime minister
without telling President Obama first
mr. Netanyahu wants the US Congress to
do all it can to block the deal that's
being negotiated with Iran this is a bad
deal it's a very bad deal we're better
off without it this deal won't be A
Farewell to Arms it would be a farewell
to arms control and the Middle East
would soon be crisscross by nuclear
tripwires a region where small
skirmishes can trigger big Wars would
turn into a nuclear tinderbox throughout
the speech he had plenty of applause but
more than 50 Democrats boycotted the
event protesting that he was
grandstanding ahead of Israeli elections
in two weeks the Democratic Leader Nancy
Pelosi said the speech insulted the
intelligence of Americans and the
administration's analysis of the threat
from Iran on the banks of Lake Geneva in
Switzerland John Kerry the US Secretary
of State with the world's big powers is
at a critical stage in the talks with
Iran the formula is for the Iranians to
accept at least 10 years of limits on
their nuclear program along with
intrusive inspections in return
sanctions would be lifted back here in
Washington President Obama said the deal
they're discussing was the best option
available but when it comes to this
nuclear deal let's wait until there's
actually a deal on the table
that Iran has agreed to at which point
everybody can evaluate it we don't have
to speculate and what I can guarantee is
that if it's a deal I've signed off on I
will be able to prove that it is the
best way for us to prevent Iran from
getting a nuclear weapon the speech was
classic Netanyahu a somewhat
contradictory mix of the politics of
fear
and expressions of Israel's strength and
resolve there is no doubt that mr.
Netanyahu sees the threat from Iran as
real and his skillful rhetoric will
connect with many Americans if there is
to be a deal
President Obama will have to deploy his
own considerable way with words to sell
it to his people Jeremy Bowen BBC News
Washington
